title: A lot of fun
text: The area around the square, as well as the square itself, is hopping. There is plenty to see and do and eat. Take a walk through and check it out.

title: Absolutely delicious
text: We had dinner here a couple of nights ago. Everything was awesome. Service was great, and the food is excellent. There are nightly specials, well worth a try. We definitely plan on going back before we go home.

title: Phenomenal
text: First, it's a hike. Make sure you have good shoes because it's a climb, and the footing is slippery in places and quite uneven at the top. But, the climb is well worth it. The ruins are spectacular and the view is amazing.

title: Just sandwiches
text: If you are looking for Greek, this is not a good choice. Cute place, but just sandwiches. You can get those at home.

title: Gorgeous museum
text: This is a beautiful museum. Take a walk through it if you have a chance. It's new, and has entire chunks of original ruins still in place to look at.

title: A very good time
text: I had a great time at this show. Super funny, talented actors, and an I would encourage anyone to go see it.

title: Great gardens, and amazing palace.
text: We spent a wonderful afternoon exploring this palace and gardens. The entry price was very reasonable, $26. for palace and gardens. Well worth it, in every way. There is even a porcelain museum in the garden area that has some really beautiful pieces in it.

title: Amazing day, with a great guide!
text: We spent the day with with our guide Angela. I would recommend this tour to everyone. We absolutely loved the whole thing. Well organized, tons of info and plenty of time to enjoy the whole day. There was a great stop in Siena, an excellent lunch, and to top off the day we got to climb the Leaning Tower of Pisa!
place: Tuscany in One Day Sightseeing Tour from Florence

title: Jewelry everywhere!
text: I don't think I have ever seen so much jewelry in my life, in one spot. What a fun way to spend a couple of hours, just window shopping. The views from the bridge are amazing, and on a nice day, it's packed with people, all having a great time.

title: Amazing art and a gorgeous setting for it.
text: I did not know what to expect, and was delighted at the the displays. Every room had a treasure. Well worth the visit. I would recommend the "skip the line" option. The lines to get in were gigantic.

title: Well worth the trip
text: We walked up the hill, and found a view that was worth every step. From every direction you will be thrilled.

title: Highly recommend
text: We spent four nights at the Giglio, and I would stay here again in a minute. This is a great location, awesome staff and clean comfy rooms with historic style. As an additional plus, the desk staff are a goldmine of info on sights and directions.

title: Don't bother
text:
I have enjoyed Pa Raffas pizza for years, so on a whim we decided to go for a walk and get a Ma Raffas pizza beforehand.

When I order a linguica pizza, I usually get some linguica. Not here. That sums it up. Very sparse toppings, undercooked and not sliced all the way thru.

In short, as I said, don't bother. Make the drive to the North end of New Bedford and get a much better pizza.

title: Don't bother
text: We have avoided Genes for years, most locals do. But, decided to give it another try tonight. Never again, it hasn't changed a bit. The food is expensive, the fish is mostly batter, and it's greasy as all hell. For an area that has the most fresh seafood around, there are far better options than Genes.

title: Best seafood around!!!
text: We get food here often. The seafood is awesome, fresh, not greasy and reasonably priced. The service is great, always friendly. There are a couple of picnic tables to sit and eat at, or you can take it home. They also have really good chowder and cacoila. Don't be lured into the bigger more "famous" place in town. This little hut is the best seafood around.

title: Great place, great location
text: We stayed at this hotel for our week in Naples and couldn't have been more pleased. The hotel is comfy and clean, the staff are very helpful and they serve a great breakfast. The train and metro are right across the street, and there is also a taxi stand. From this hotel, you can get anywhere in the city very easily. Would highly recommend.

title: Awesome Ice Cream
text: Stopped in here on a Friday afternoon and had ice cream. There was one very friendly girl working and I had the BEST chocolate peanut butter ice cream ever!!!

title: Took a chance, loved it.
text: We were walking around the neighborhood near our hotel looking for a place to eat that was a little different from the fish and chip style. We looked at the menu on the outside of this restaurant and decided to give it a shot. The place was almost empty, so we sat immediately, in our choice of seats. The waiters were very helpful, offering good info on the food, and apps. We started with the hummis and naan bread, an excellent choice. The bread was fresh from the oven, we devoured it. Our entrees were lamb with rice and veggies, and they were just as delicious. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone and if I ever go back to London, I will eat here again.

title: Amazing place, and free to the public.
text: The V & A Museum is a must see. The admission is free, and you could spend a day here. There is also a nice cafe and tea area that had excellent tea and scones. Take some time and walk thru the museum, it's weel worth it.

title: Just as awesome as I thought!!!
text: Coming up from the Westminster Tube station, this was the first thing I saw! What a sight, I would recommend everyone see this for themselves.

title: Gorgeous
text: We waited in line for about 20 minutes to get into the Abbey. Not a big deal, I've seen much worse. Once inside you are handed a talking guide, and it came in pretty handy as it's a self guided tour. The inside of the Abbey is breathtaking, no other way to describe it. The entire tour took about 2 hours and I bet we could have stayed longer, there is so much to see. Well worth a trip and just as beautiful as I imagined it would be.

title: Very impressive
text: We didn't know a lot about the Royal Albert Hall, but it didn't matter. We had a great tour guide and spent a wonderful couple of hours seeing the inside and hearing the history of this beautiful building. The Hall is used constantly, and it manages to be historically accurate and modern day functional. Pretty impressive and worth the tour. You will be walking in the footsteps of Kings and Queens.

title: Use it, it is excellent!
text: The London Underground is the way to get around, hands down. Don't bother with a taxi, get an Oyster Card and use the Underground, it's inexpensive and will get you anywhere you want to go.

title: Awesome!!
text: The Bridge is not only impressive from the outside, but the inside is just as good. The upper walkways have a glass bottom, and the views are tremendous. Downstairs are some examples of the mechanics of the Bridge, also not to be missed. Go see it, you will be glad you did.

title: Beautiful Walk
text: The Gardens are very impressive. We walked from one end to the other, it's a long walk, but there is a lot to see along the way. The Gardens are well maintained, and so pretty. Also the Diana Memorial Fountain is in here and that is a must see.

title: Impressive
text: The Castle is owned by an entertainment company that has restored it very nicely. It's pretty impressive and full of original furniture and decorations. There is also a really good video presentation of the History of the Castle, if you get a chance, watch it too.

title: Goosebump inducing
text: One of my must sees!! Stonehenge is every bit as awesome as I thought. The first sight of it is almost enough to give you goosebumps. It's incredible and wonderful and I am glad I saw it.

title: Impressive
text: The Bath's are pretty wonderful and the history is impressive. You can just imagine that thousands of years of history are all on display. The tour is self guided and well explained with the hand held player.

title: Great Market
text: Just be aware that it closes at 5pm, we got there too late the first day. This is a great Market, there are vendors and craftspeople of all kinds. The prices and variety are both very good and, there are all kinds of food vendors also!!

title: Great fish and chips
text: We stopped in here during our tour of the Westminster area. The Tavern is centrally located, next to Underground, but has plenty of seating and we didn't wait for a table. Upstairs seating is comfy and the service was quick. I would recommend the fish and chips, but everything looked good and the prices are very reasonable.

title: Good food, good prices
text: We had a late dinner here, at around 8:30 there was still a full dinng room, but we only waited about 10 minutes. As soon as we were seated the waiter was right there with the specials and taking drink order. The food was delicious and the price was reasonable. Well worth a visit, if you like Italian food.

title: Not a great experience
text: We stopped here on our first night in London. Walking around, unsure of where to eat, this place looked good. We were seated in the back, very crowded and not even able to get out after. The wait staff may have been very busy, but we waited an awful long time for service and had a hard time ordering, the waitress was not helpful in explaining the different dishes. The food was OK, but I wouldn't recommend it, for the money, there a a ton of other better places.

title: For the money, a great hotel
text: I read the reviews before I went, so I was not sure what to expect. We arrived early on a Thursday and couldn't check in yet, bummer, but they do offer a luggage storage area so it was ok. When we did check in, I admit the room was small, two twin beds and not much else. Once we got used to that, the rest of our stay went great. The breakfast buffet is good, best scrambled eggs ever. The room was clean, no noise problem at night and the staff was friendly and helpful.The wi-fi issue is dumb, I agree that charging for it is silly, that would be my only, minor, complaint. However, everyplace in London has free wi-fi so it wasn't really an issue. I would stay here again, the location is excellent, two underground stations right around the corner, and a ton of restaurants also.

title: Very pretty and busy
text: Trafalgar Square was on my list of must sees and it did not disappoint. We caught a sunny day and there were a ton of people enjoying it also. Go see it, it's awesome.

title: Great visit!
text: The Tower of London is so much more than I thought. You could spend a half a day here, there is so much to see. Make sure you see the Crown Jewels, very impressive. Great sight and well worth a visit.

title: You could spend an entire day here
text: You could literally spend a day in this museum and still not see it all, and, it's free. There are some very impressive works of art, and it's a beautiful museum. Also a very nice cafe.

title: Just as I imagined.
text: The first glimpse of Buckingham Palace was awesome. It;s just big and beautiful as I thought and very easy to get to.

title: Good Food, good price.
text: Mike's is always good. If you are looking for fine dining, don't bother, but for a good meal at a good price, try it.

title: This place has gone downhill
text: I have liked Wah May for years, but I have just had my second terrible meal there. I had a lousy meal a month or so ago, but I thought I would try again. Well, if anything, it was worse. I got pork lo mein, no pork, dry noodles and rubbery mushrooms. That's it. The prices are not cheap and it's terrible, don't bother.

title: Worth stopping for.
text: This bridge is awesome. It's restored perfectly, and it's in a very nice spot to pull over and take in the view and take pictures.

title: Spend some time here
text: We hiked a couple of the Falls here. The trails are well maintained and well marked, and well worth spending the time. Awesome views and plenty of gorgeous pictures!

title: Great stay
text: We booked a night at the Comfort Suites in Freeport at the last minute, while on our way to Freeport. I picked this one based on it's closeness to L.L. Bean and the free breakfast. We checked in late, around 9, and were given a nice, clean, comfy room right away. We made a run over to L. L. Bean, and came back to our room for a great nights sleep. It was quiet, even though were were pretty close to the lobby area. In the morning we had a very nice breakfast, included, and were on our way again. I would stay here again, for sure. It's a mile from the downtown Freeport shopping area, straight shot.

title: Stopped in for a drink, great band!
text: We stopped here on our way back to the hotel from L.L. Bean, late on a Friday night. There was a really good band playing, place was kind of empty but the service was good and the drinks excellant.

title: Fantastic Find!
text: We stopped in Dingle on a trip trough the Dingle Peninsula for lunch. The bus driver, on the way into town recommended another restaurant for lunch, but it was packed. We walked next door to John Benny's and went in to eat. What a great idea that turned out to be! This place is cozy and comfy, the waitress was friendly and helpful and we ate the best fish and chips I think I have ever had. I'm not kidding you, this was a great lunch! The menu was big, but it the clear choice. The fish was perfect, the chips also perfect and it was served with a delicious side salad. If you have a chance, stop here and heve lunch, you will leave full and happy.

title: Nice enough but had issues
text: We stayed at the Stormont for one night on a recent tour. There were three in our party and, one of us got the dreaded cot. In this instance, the cot turned out to be OK. The problem with this Hotel was the smell. The rooms, and it seemed to be most of them, smelled awful. The smell came from the bathroom sink drains. You have to close the drain, and close the bathroom door. Hopefully, this works, in some cases the smell was still too much. Too bad because it seems like a nice enough place. There is a nice restaurant, although they were way understaffed when we got there with 45 people, the food, when you finally got it, was delicious. Not so much the breakfast, but it was decent.

title: A must see.
text: As much as I thought I knew about the Titantic, I found out that it wasn't much. This museum is fantastic. You could spend hours here and still not see it all. If you have a chance, go see it. You won't be sorry.

title: One night, but very pleasant
text: We stayed one night in Derry. The room was big, clean and very comfy. Service was good, considering we arrived with 45 people, they handled it very well and were pleasant and helpful. There is a nice bar and breakfast buffett and I would stay here again.

title: Take the tour, you will not be sorry.
text: The City Walls are very impressive. Just seeing them is great but taking the tour is an eye opener. Derry has am impressive, and not always happy, history, but the people and the City are awesome.

title: Very nice visit
text: The Guildhall is free to the Public and it is not only gorgeous but educational. There is an Historic, interactive exhibit that is well worth visiting. As an added bonus, the day we visited, there was a Christmas Fair on the second floor. make sure you go up there and at least check out the fantastic organ.

title: One night stay, great sleep
text: On a recent whirlwind tour of Ireland we stayed here for one night. I wish we could have spent longer, the Hotel was great as well as the location. The beds were super comfortable, the room was huge and the bathroom was great. There was a nice breakfast buffet and over all I recommend this hotel. If I ever get the chance to go back, I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

title: Awesome dinner!
text: I had checked Trip Advisor for restaurants before my trip and seen this place. Once we actually got to Galway, it was dark and I was afraid we would never find the place. Well, we walked around and were lucky enough to actually find it and it was open. The pies are fantastic, it's a tiny place place so again we were lucky and there was an empty table. This was one of the best meals I had in Ireland and I would encourage anyone who is in Galway to check it out.

title: Has to be seen to be believed.
text: Words and pictures will never do this place justice. The day we visited it was clear and we were able to walk around pretty comfortably. I was amazed and impressed and would encourage anyone thinking of stopping here to do it. There is also a very nice Visitor Center and Cafe if you have time.

title: Impressive
text: Impressive sights and lots of places to stop and take pictures. The only thing is the pictures will never do it justice, check it out.

title: I wish I could give it 10 stars!
text: We visted the Giants Causeway on a tour, and we were lucky enough to be able to spend enough time to really look around. There is a mini bus that will take you down and back, but it isn't a long walk and you can see more if you walk. I had heard of this place but wasn't prepared for how awesome it is in person. We walked around down at the bottom and found a trail that takes you back to the Visitors Center. The trails are well marked and this one went straight up the cliffs. The sights on the way up and at the top are breathtaking, don't be afraid to take the trail if you have time. It's well maintained and there is room to stop and rest if you need to. You won't be sorry and you will truly appreciate how gorgeous this pace is.

title: Very nice cafe and gift shop.
text: After walking around the Causeway itself, this Visitor Center is a welcome place to stop and have lunch. It's big and bright and you could spend a couple of hours here easily.

title: Second time here and just as good.
text: I stayed here last year and enjoyed it so on my trip this year we stayed here again. It was just as good as I remember, the rooms and the service and the restaurant. The hotel is clean and the beds are super comfortable. We had a room with three people, there were plenty of beds, and the bathrooms were well equipped with supplies for three. A great stay in a great hotel, again.

title: Don't miss it!
text: This little church has one of the funkiest crypt tours you will ever take. The hours are kind of odd, as in very few, but if you can time it out, take the tour. It's small and very old, the crypts are downstairs, I won't spoil the fun too much, because you have to see it yourself. It's the most fun 10 euros I spent!
